result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: 3:00 PM Defendant Bruce M. Johnson in court, in custody.  Attorney Peter Michael Masana in court for Bruce M. Johnson.  Attorney Emily Eklund in court for State of Wisconsin.  State notes victim notification has been met.  State moves to dismiss but read in case.  No objection from Atty Masana. Court grants the motion and dismisses but reads in case.
Plea hearing on October 27, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
Plea hearing on October 27, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

1:04 PM Defendant Bruce M. Johnson in court, in custody.  Prosecuting attorney Rick C Spoentgen in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Peter Masana also appears.  He reps in other cases.  Requests this track w/those matters.  State doesn't object.  Court advises Atty Masana to reach out to PD's office re: appointment.  Bond continued.
Plea hearing scheduled for October 17, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Plea hearing on October 17, 2022 at 10:30 am.

2:43 PM Prosecuting attorney Emily Eklund in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Bruce M. Johnson appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Blake Duren appeared by video for Bruce M. Johnson. Defendant received and waives reading of complaint.  Court advises DE of charges/max penalties.  DE qualifies for PD representation.  File set for pre-trial conference/return date.  State recommends a signature bond.  No objection from Atty Duren.  $500.00 SIGNATURE bond set.  Special bond conditions as follows: May not deface the property he is currently residing in.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 16, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Return date scheduled for October 11, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Return date on October 11, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Pre-trial conference on September 16, 2022 at 11:00 am.
